intro: Euphrasia stricta subsp. pseudosuecica, commonly known as the narrow-leaved eyebright, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a hairy texture. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal remedies.
